t: Century-old Seattle-area snack maker Oberto sold to Canadian conglomerate | The Seattle Times
s: April 13, 2018 - Premium Brands, a company with more than 47 brands under its ownership, is the buyer of Kent-based Oberto, a family-owned meat snack maker. ... After a century of making sausage, the Oberto family is selling their namesake business to a large Canadian food conglomerate.

t: Oberto Sausage Company - A Washington State Business Legend
s: January 25, 2018 - The story of the Oberto Sausage Company originates in Italy in 1918. It was there that a young Constantino Oberto, like many immigrants at the turn of the century, dreamed of a better life for him and his family.

t: Frito-Lay North America and the Oberto Sausage Company Agree to End Partnership
s: Founded in Seattle in 1918, the Oberto Sausage Company is one of the nation's top beef jerky producers and meat snack food brands. For more than 90 years, three generations of the Oberto family have been making fine quality meat snacks while living up to the company motto - Have Fun!

t: About — Oberto Specialty Meats
s: A lot has changed in the 101 years since Constantino Oberto arrived in America with a little more than the shirt on his back and the recipes in his pocket. What was once a tiny brand delivered by bicycle after school is now America’s most beloved and innovative specialty meats company.
